climbs.name: Slap and Tickle
climbs.fa: Pat Brennan, John Cardmon and Brad Singer, July 1999

content.description:
Jam or lieback an easy hand/fist crack (5.8) to a stance then move left and climb the delicate slabby arete to the top.

Excellent rock, excellent exposure and positioning with moves on the upper slab that are reminiscent of Suicide Rock in Idyllwild.
content.location: Left side of the west face on the arete.

climbs.name: Firewalker
climbs.fa: (TR) Eric Odenthal & Chris Miller, June 2000, FL: Eric Odenthal, June 2000

content.description: Technical climbing along a seam down low (crux) leads to a long section of slab climbing to anchors.
content.location:
Just right of

Black and Tan

.

Start as for

Firewalker

then break right following a seam.

content.description:
Jam or lieback an easy hand/fist crack (5.8) to a stance then move right and climb the thin seam past four bolts until the angle eases and you can move left to join

Slap and Tickle

for it's last two bolts and anchors. Quality.
content.location:
Just right of

Slap and Tickle

.

content.description: Boulder up to a high first bolt just above a small overlap/roof and tackle the tricky seam which splits the face. Thin and continuous movement throughout.
